children.subject: It sounds like you want to review the policies @6889 and make sure you understand them.

history.content:
The email you got from ronreply has nothing to do with prerequisites. Campus systems don't yet check for prerequisites.

Whether or not you've taken 61B or 61BL is immaterial (except indirectly as it implies you are not yet declared a CS major) towards your goal of enrolling in 170.

The email you got is about you not yet being a CS major..

Your questions 3 and 5 ask for anyone who responds to be able to see into the future and correctly predict the free-will decisions of hundreds and thousands of other UC B students.

As to 4, by the time summer grades are in, enrollment for CS classes is irrespective of major and just by waitlist order which means it will indeed matter if you phase 1 the class because you'll be much higher on the waitlist than if you wait to choose the class.

Hello, I am an intended CS major freshman.
I took CS 61A and CS 70 so far, and I am trying to enroll in CS 170 in Fall 2018, since I am gonna take 61BL over the summer.
So I got waitlisted in CS 170 during Phase 1 since I am not a declared CS major yet. (more precisely, waitlist position 520)
However, I got an enrollment update from NoReply@berkeley.edu that I can't enroll from the waitlist since I didn't full prerequisites. (i.e. 61B)
I am certain that I can declare CS if I take 61B over the summer based on my grades so far.
So, here are my questions.
1) Would I still be able to take 170 during fall if I'm taking 61BL over the summer?
2) Should I not phase 1 CS 170 and enroll later during adjustment period after this summer?
3) If I have to enroll in CS 170 after the summer session, would there be still seats in CS170 in August?
4) If I eventually declare after this summer, would it be effective to my enrollment status?
5) How strict is CS 170 with enrollment limit? If I am a CS major in August, would they allow me to take CS 170?
Thank you so much for your help.
history.subject: Taking 61BL over the summer and Enrolling in CS 170 for fall 2018
